ai-sn6:10.4.5_0: “That’s what Brahmā Sahampati said. Then he bowed and respectfully circled me, keeping me on his right, before vanishing right there.”

ai-sn6:10.6.1_1: And at the end of every hundred years someone would remove a single seed from it.
ai-sn6:10.6.2_0: By this means the Kosalan cartload of twenty bushels of sesame seed would run out faster than a single lifetime in the Abbuda hell.

ai-sn6:10.6.12_0: The mendicant Kokālika has been reborn in the Pink Lotus hell because of his resentment for Sāriputta and Moggallāna.”

ai-sn6:14.2.1_0: “Once upon a time, mendicants, there was a king named Aruṇavā.
ai-sn6:14.2.2_0: He had a capital named Aruṇavatī.

ai-sn6:14.2.4_0: Sikhī had a fine pair of chief disciples named Abhibhū and Sambhava.
ai-sn6:14.2.5_0: Then the Buddha Sikhī addressed the mendicant Abhibhū,
ai-sn6:14.2.6_0: ‘Come, brahmin, let’s go to the Brahmā realm for as long as he likes.’
ai-sn6:14.2.8_0: Then the Buddha Sikhī, as easily as a strong person would extend or contract their arm, vanished from Jeta’s Grove and reappeared among the mendicants.
ai-sn6:14.2.8_1: so did he vanish from Aruṇavatī and appeared in that Brahmā realm.
ai-sn6:14.3.1_0: Then the Buddha Sikhī addressed the mendicant Abhibhū,
ai-sn6:14.3.2_0: ‘Brahmin, please speak of Brahmā’s retinue with the teaching and the assembly of Brahmā.’
ai-sn6:14.3.3_0: ‘Yes, sir,’ replied Abhibhū. Then he educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired them with a Dhamma talk.
ai-sn6:14.3.4_0: But the Brahmā, his assembly, and his retinue complained, grumbled, and objected,
ai-sn6:14.3.5_0: ‘It’s incredible, it’s amazing! How on earth can a disciple teach Dhamma in the presence of the Teacher?’
ai-sn6:14.4.1_0: Then the Buddha Sikhī addressed the mendicant Abhibhū,
ai-sn6:14.4.2_0: ‘Brahmin, Brahmā, his assembly, and his retinue are complaining
ai-sn6:14.4.3_0: that a disciple teaches Dhamma in the presence of the Teacher.
ai-sn6:14.4.4_0: Well then, brahmin, stir them up even more!’
ai-sn6:14.4.5_0: ‘Yes, sir,’ replied Abhibhū. Then he taught Dhamma with his body visible; with his body invisible; with the lower half visible and the upper half invisible; and with the upper half visible and the lower half invisible.
ai-sn6:14.4.6_0: And the Brahmā, his assembly, and his retinue, their minds full of wonder and amazement, thought,
ai-sn6:14.4.7_0: ‘It’s incredible, it’s amazing! The ascetic has such psychic power and might!’
